meanings.definition: To make something varied in appearance or color.
meanings.sent1: She decided to variegate her wardrobe by adding colorful scarves.
meanings.sent2: The artist used different shades to variegate the painting and make it more interesting.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to variegate the flavors in the dish, but it ended up tasting strange.
meanings.sent4: The garden was variegated with flowers of all colors, like a rainbow on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The sky variegated with hues of pink and orange as the sun set.

meanings.sent1: The variegate leaves on the tree created a beautiful mosaic of colors.
meanings.sent2: The variegate patterns on the butterfly's wings were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The variegate sky at sunset looked like a painting by a famous artist.
meanings.sent4: Her variegate outfit stood out in a sea of plain black dresses.
meanings.sent5: The variegate landscape was a sight to behold, with mountains, forests, and rivers all in one view.
